name: 鄭傅儒
objective: 以創意的實作訓練為主﹐藉由家具與室內設計空間之相關性的主題, 透過實際設計程序的演練以培養設計的能力。
schedule:
選修的同學必須包含﹕
一. 設計實作部份﹕
在德國Lichtenfels舉辦的設計營 (Prof. Auwi Stübbe/Innovations-Centerum Lichtenfels,共同指導)
First Workshop project 2014 - Rattan meets Taiwan

Subject:MATERIAL AND SUSTAINABILITY 
	Resources and Creativity
	Design strategy for rattan furniture construction

Participants:Students of National Taipei University of Technology 
Designer and students from Germany

Attendance: 30 Taiwanese Students and 10 German Students/Designers

Management:
Prof. Dr. Frue Cheng National Taipei University of Technology
Prof. Auwi Stübbe,	Innovation Center Lichtenfels
Prof. Jan Armgardt, Innovation Center Lichtenfels
Prof. Frank Sander, Innovation Center Lichtenfels
Assistance: Klaus Jacob, Master of Rattan maker, IZL

Workshop venue:	D 96215 Lichtenfels, Germany, Schneidmühlweg 28

Material:The participants bring drawing material:
-pencil with soft lead,
-measuring instruments
-tracing paper, 
-masking tape (Tesa)

Basic material: The basic material used for the models – thin rattan poles 2 to 4 mm diameter – are provided for the participants.

Challenge	
1. Create a light, small easy chair! Alternative
2. Create a small, light daybed

Targets of workshop: Training objectives: 
To qualify Taiwanese design students and designer in designing rattan furniture for the international market by:  
-strategic, methodical approach with the generation of ideas, the styling and model development,
-quality standards in technique,
-ergonomic norms and standards
-aesthetic standards, targeting of market groups

Working objectives: Within the workshop time each participant creates a model-form in the scale 1:10 or 1:5/1:6  (depends on the Ideas) important details will be worked out as prototypes scale 1:1 

Technical dokumentation: It will be kept records in suitable form on the single design steps. 

Presentation: The working objectives are to be prepared in a way to be convenient for a daily presentation as well as for the terminal presentation.


Scheduling
1.Day,2014/01/20 Mo:Introduction of the participants – becoming acquainted of the participants. Introducing of the scope of work by the managers and explanation of the process and the objectives.
Set up of the work stations. Daily target: Set up work stations and clearness about the scope of work, First ideas

2.Day,2014/01/21 Thu:Form finding
Ideas, drafts, little models. Transfer of the ideas to model-forms scale 1:10/1:5/1:6 using thin rattan poles. Daily target: Ideas suitable for realization.

3.Day,2014/01/22 We: Transfer of the ideas to model-forms scale 1:10/1:5/1:6 using thin rattan poles. Daily target: Constructive and structural clearness

4.Day, 2014/01/23 Th: Ergonomic design matching with the construction and Test of the seating respectively lying comfort.
Studies of the surfaces, Material studies of the netting Elaboration, bringing together of netting and Daily target: Model-form scale 1:10/1:5/1:6 plus detailed studies construction

5.Day, 2014/01/24 Fr: Elaboration and preparation for the presentation Presentation. Daily target: participant, Challenge Satisfied students who recognize this is a good way for a sustainable design strategy

Special experts 	Prof. Jan Armgardt, Schondorf/Aachen
as teachers for 	Prof. Frank Sander, Trier
one day

6. and 7. Day,opportunities	:Reserve days for excursions. 
Day excursion to the City of Bamberg UNESCO world Heritage By train 30 minutes from Lichtenfels

Visit the German Wicker-Work-Musem in a small village Michelau, near to Lichtenfels
Visit the Banz Monastery and Basilica of the Fourteen Holy
by car 20 minutes
Visit a upholstery furniture factory

Daily targets: Good impressions of Upper Franconia and Bavaria
